seo.title: Corniglia FAQ 2025 | Common Questions Answered
seo.description: Frequently asked questions about Corniglia. Lardarina stairs, beaches, hiking, dining, accessibility, and practical visitor information.

body.title: Frequently Asked Questions
body.subtitle: Everything you need to know about visiting Corniglia.

features.title: How many steps in the Lardarina?
features.description: 382 steps from the train station to the village. Takes 10-15 minutes. Shuttle bus available if needed.

features.title: Does Corniglia have a beach?
features.description: No direct beach access. It's the only Cinque Terre village without a beach. Take train to Vernazza or Manarola.

features.title: Is Corniglia crowded?
features.description: Least crowded of all five villages. The staircase deters many tourists. Most authentic local atmosphere.

features.title: How long to spend in Corniglia?
features.description: 2-3 hours to see highlights. Half day with lunch. Full day if hiking or staying overnight.

features.title: Can I bring luggage?
features.description: Challenging with heavy bags. Stairs or limited shuttle bus only. Contact your hotel for luggage porterage service.

features.title: What is Corniglia famous for?
features.description: Lardarina staircase, terraced vineyards, Vernaccia wine, and being Cinque Terre's only clifftop village.
